aboutPage.title: About TraceIt
aboutPage.missionText: TraceIt's mission is to provide a seamless and efficient platform for managing lost and found items within the campus community. We leverage technology to reconnect students and staff with their valuable belongings, fostering a more connected and supportive environment.
aboutPage.step1Text: Found something? Report it in seconds. Lost something? Post a request and let the community help you out.
aboutPage.step2Text: Our AI-powered system analyzes descriptions, categories, and locations to help you find potential matches quickly.
aboutPage.step3Text: Once a match is found, you can securely contact the other person to arrange the retrieval of the item.
aboutPage.creatorText: TraceIt was developed by a team of passionate students dedicated to enhancing campus life through innovative solutions. This application was brought to life through the collaborative effort and dedication of three passionate students: Sudhanwa, Aditya Jha, and Pawan Meena. Our diverse backgrounds in technology, design, and community service drive us to create tools that make a real difference. We believe in the power of collaboration and are committed to continuously improving TraceIt based on user feedback and evolving needs. Join us in making our campus a safer and more connected place! Feel free to reach out to us with any questions or suggestions.

homePageBenefits.title: Why Use TraceIt on Campus?
homePageBenefits.card1Text: Found or lost an item? Post a report in under a minute with our simple, guided forms.
homePageBenefits.card2Text: Our smart system uses semantic search to find the most relevant matches for your lost items, increasing your chances of recovery.
homePageBenefits.card3Text: Earn service points and rewards by helping your fellow students. Be a campus hero!

claimModal.title: Item Claim Request
claimModal.claimSentSuccess: Claim request sent successfully! You can manage it in 'My Queries'.

items.q: How does the AI matching work?
items.a: Our system converts your item description into a special numeric code (a vector). It then compares this code to all items in the database to find the ones with the most similar meaning, not just keywords.

Yes. We only share necessary contact information after a claim has been made and a chat is initiated. Sensitive data like your Aadhaar number is encrypted and requires password verification to view or edit.

items.q: What happens after I claim an item?
items.a: The person who reported the item is notified. They can then accept your request to chat. In the chat, you can provide proof of ownership. Once the reporter is satisfied, they will mark the item as resolved.

items.q: How do I earn service points?
items.a: You earn 100 service points for every found item you report that is successfully returned to its owner through the claim process on our platform.

helpPage.title: Help Center
helpPage.a1: Click the 'Register' button on the navbar and fill in your college details. You will need a valid college email and roll number to sign up.
helpPage.q2: How do I report an item I found?
helpPage.a2: Navigate to the 'Report Item' page from the navbar. Fill in all the details as accurately as possible, especially the category and a good description. Uploading a clear photo is highly recommended as it greatly increases the chances of a successful return.
helpPage.q3: How do I claim an item?
helpPage.a3: After you submit a 'Request Item' form for something you lost, you will be taken to a page with potential matches found by our AI. On this page, click the 'Request to Chat & Claim' button on an item you believe is yours. This will notify the person who found it.
helpPage.q4: Where can I manage my claims?
helpPage.a4: The 'My Queries' page is your central dashboard. It has separate sections for claims you've made on other people's items and claims others have made on items you reported. You can manage all your claim-related activities there.
helpPage.a5: Once you claim an item, the reporter is notified. They must accept your request to chat. In the private chat, you can provide proof of ownership (like describing a unique scratch, the lock screen wallpaper, etc.). If the reporter is satisfied, they will mark the claim as resolved. You must then confirm you have received the item to complete the process.
